column1: 1 ^ Fundāmenta ejus in montibus sānctīs; ^ The foundations thereof are the holy mountains.
2 ^ dīligit Dominus portās Sion super omnia tabernācula Jācōbis. ^ The Lord loveth the gates of Sion above all the tabernacles of Jacob.

column2: cīvitās Deī. ^ Glorious things are said of thee
et Babilōnis scientium mē. Ecce aliēnigenae et Tirus et populus Aetiopum
column3: hī fuērunt illīc. ^ I will be mindful of Rahab and of Babylon knowing me. Behold the foreigners and Tyre and the people of the Ethiopians

column2: « Homō et homō nātus est in eā
column3: et ipse fundāvit eam Altissimus »? ^ Shall not Sion say
column4: "This man and that man is born in her
column5: and the Highest himself hath founded her?

column4: quī fuērunt in eā. ^ The Lord shall tell in his writings of peoples and of princes
column5: of them that have been in her.

column1: 7 ^ Sīcut laetantium omnium habitātiō est in tē. ^ The dwelling in thee is as it were of all rejoicing.
